column2: Steve, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I  am a 51 yr old male who had to have back surgery but had a low platelet count.my Dr put me on Danozol for 3 months and my platletes shot back up.....must primary care and other doctors were not aware of this benifit of this drug. so if any one runs across someone in that situation please tell them to talk to there doc.

column2: smj1978, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Prior to the treatment, I had a large endometriomia cyst removed which encompassed my ovary.  When I first started the danazol I felt horrible.  I have severe headaches and vomiting, but these side effects went away.  After 6 months of the treatment I still was bleeding daily, so my doctor has put me on Divigel for 7 days and scheduled an ultrasound.

column9: this treatment cause me liver problems so i reccomend to ask your doctor about using it

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am very dizzy and drunk feeling.. I feel disoriented not sure about taking it ..will discuss with doc after reading reviews that it makes others sick.  Not sure of effectiveness havent been on it that long

column2: caity, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking danazol for 10 years because I have hereditary angioedema. I have to take this medication or I end up in the hospital. I wish I could find the company that makes this medication because Sometimes I can't afford the danazol.

column2: TT, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 2 years. My dosage has increased to 100mg twice daily. I do not have breast pain anymore. Slight weight gain and flushing but nothing severe.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
noname, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm on a low dose 100/day for breast pain.  Breast pain reduced but not gone.  Side effects include lower back pain, dizziness, frequent (daily) bleeding/spotting and a weird feeling in my throat, like I swallowed a grape that won't go all the way down the esophagus (I didn't see this listed in the posted side effects).  Some vomiting, but without nausea - weird.  No weight gain on this low dose. Anyway, I've been on it a month and will continue the drug to see if the breast pain goes away completely (I hope the bleeding stops too). My breast pain was so bad, even these side effects are worth the reduction in pain I have experienced so far.

column2: Jeff M, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on Danazol for 42 years. It has proven to be effective in preventing HAE.The main side affect for me has been weight gain.

column2: David, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking it for ITP and it has kept my platlets up but I am concerned about the side effects

column2: Todd, 35-44 Male  (Patient)
column9: i have used this drug for 15 years with no side effects controls H A very well

column2: Relieved, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I recently had the dose increased to 200 mg daily to reduce breast itching. It appears to be working because my breast cysts fluid activity has decreased. I don't have to have the painful aspirations as often and the pain has stopped. I want to know about long term effects too. So far I've only had slight weight gain but not sure how new dosage will affect my weight. Some doctors say take for a while where as my new prescription will be ongoing.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: HAVE BEEN ON DANAZOL FOR 28 YEARS AND HAS BEEN WORTH THE SIDE EFFECTS TO LIVE WITHOUT PAIN AND SWELLING.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have heriditary angio edema and have been on this for 28 years and the side effects are worth living without pain

column2: thunder, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
animan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: it makes me feel drowsy, moody and un balance. i also felt a bit heaty and headache. what i hate the most, i put on weight easily eventhough on diet.

column2: Fran, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: 14 years of infertility.  Surgery for endometriosis / adhesions followed by 6 months Danocrine.  Result one baby girl...29 year old lawyer with no birth defects.  Could not be better.  For me.....only mild pain after pregnancy.

To my treat endometriosis, I had laser surgery, was on this drug and two other pills.  My doctors told me that I wouldn't be able to conceive, let along give birth to children...Today, I am a proud mother!  Praise GOD!!!

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have a condition called ITP and have been using it for a number of years 200mg 2x per day.

column2: jules, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Used for treatment of transfusion-dependent anemia caused by IMF & MDS.  Thrilled with results; 1st time in years that my body is making healthy red blood cells.  Side effects (dizziness, lack of menses, lower back/joint pain) are well worth ability to live normally again.  I am very concerned with lack of long-term effect data. MDs say I can stay on this long term, but if that's so, why are athletes told to stay away from anabolic steroids?
